question: What is the commutative field considered in this document?
A linear system is said to be homogeneous if:
answers: All the constants on the right-hand side are zero
All the constants on the right-hand side are non-zero
The system has an infinite number of solutions

question: If a linear system has at least one solution, it is said to be:
The rank of a linear system is defined as:
answers: The rank of the coefficient matrix
The rank of the constant matrix
The rank of the augmented matrix

question: In the vector form of a linear system, the columns of the coefficient matrix represent:
A Cramer system is a linear system:
answers: Whose column vectors are linearly dependent

question: For a Cramer system, the unique solution is given by:
In a general linear system, the principal equations are:
answers: The equations whose coefficients are non-zero
The first equations up to the rank of the system
The equations whose constants are non-zero

question: In a general linear system, the principal unknowns are:
answers: The unknowns whose coefficients are non-zero
The first unknowns up to the rank of the system
The unknowns whose constants are non-zero

question: The principal matrix of a general linear system is:
answers: The submatrix of order equal to the rank with a non-zero determinant

question: According to the Rouché-Fontené theorem, a necessary condition for the compatibility of a linear system is that:
answers: All the bordered determinants of the principal determinant are zero
All the bordered determinants of the principal determinant are non-zero

question: In a compatible general linear system, the principal unknowns are determined:
answers: In terms of the non-principal unknowns by a Cramer system
By solving the matrix equation AX = B

question: If a linear system of n equations with m unknowns has a rank r, then:
In Cramer's rule for a system of n equations with n unknowns, the denominator is:
answers: The determinant of the coefficient matrix
The determinant of the constant matrix
The determinant of the augmented matrix
The product of the determinants of the coefficient and constant matrices

question: If a linear system is incompatible, this means that:
answers: It has an infinite number of solutions
It has at least one solution
